The 8 Best Pieces of Business Advice I've Received In The Past 6 Months
Had a fantastic time speaking about how NOT to turn your Agile Teams into Backlog Lumberjacks  at Agile Arizona 2017 last Friday.
When my businesses both failed, my identity failed. I felt shame.
I failed twice in my life.
The first was a web app product. Lost $6k.
The second was a membership business. Lost 7 months of my life.
- The membership business scaled like a slug. Unviable.
I put myself out there for these projects.
THESE ARE IT! I said. MY FUTURE!
So when they failed, my identity failed. I doubted myself.
The poet Rudyard Kipling wrote this couplet in the poem "If":
And treat those two impostors just the same;'
In other words, failure and success are straw in the fire of life. Fuel that keeps us going, but fuel that burns away in an instant.
Your identity is more than what you do and the results.
Treat comfortable success as a diving board to jump into risk.
Treat uncomfortable failure as an opportunity to learn how to swim in difficult times.
Cheers. And God bless your ambitions for the good of the world.
Helping mentor the next generation of entrepreneurs.

I serve in wholehearted partnership with my wife, Nicole Cottrell, as she invests in marriages between entrepreneurs and non-entrepreneurs. Having gained from her unrelenting support for 10 years in my own entrepreneurial efforts, Love & Startups now helps similar couples realize that they, too, don't have to choose: they can build a healthy marriage AND a thriving startup. Or as we like to say:Succeed at Both

Jonathan Cottrell is one of the stars in the Phoenix startup community, gently and lovingly giving his time, service, wisdom and energy. In many ways he embodies servant leadership, with a desire to help others succeed with no expectation or interest in direct reciprocity. Another way to describe Jonathan is he "leads with love" and you can see this from his actions and behaviors.If you get an opportunity to work with him, I encourage you to take it!

'Ridiculously efficient and full of compassion’ is the phrase that comes to mind when I think about Jonathan and team at Hopscratch. I had the pleasure of working with Hopscratch when I started my business, Blissential. Jonathan and team were eager to support me as an entrepreneur so I could get started quickly and easily. Their expertise is industry agnostic yet geared to your specific needs as a business owner. As a soon to be business owner, you can't imagine all the things that you need to consider with setting up, yet wIth Hopscratch, I was able to get every foundational license and program that I needed so I could stay focused on the vision. Jonathan and his team have assembled a 'business in a box' and they made the whole process so seamless from effortless logistics to powerful tools. Every person on the Hopscratch team was incredibly accommodating and fun to work with and I highly recommend Hopscratch and their methodology. If you are thinking about starting a business, do yourself a favor and reach out to Hopscratch immediately!

Christie is everywhere in Phoenix, and that's a very good thing for us all! Everywhere she goes, she brings a neighborly spirit to help entrepreneurs and the local startup scene, educating and connecting all she comes to meet and know, whether that's over impromptu coffee run-ins, StartupGrind's monthly events, or at the local coworking spots in town. There isn't anything Christie wouldn't do to help you and your business succeed. Even more importantly than all this, she's an extremely kind and pleasant person to be around--something we all need more of these days.
